page.title: 04GRIMSBY-CLEETHORPES MERGER?
page.content: Grimsby and Cleethorpes have always been{separate boroughs.}The people who live in Cleethorpes - the{"Meggies"}- have always been keen to be independent.In 1985 the "Grimsby Evening Telegraph" published the headline "Time to Link Up".The Grimsby Council want to join Grimsby and Cleethorpes in order to create a {mini-city}of 200000 people,attract big companies,make the area better known and make facilities better.Many who wrote to the "Telegraph" were in favour and thought of names for the city such as{Humberville}or{Havlock.} Others thought it would be too big and that more industry would bring pollution.Councillor Leam of Cleethorpes wanted a{referendum.}The Mayor of Cleethorpes, with other councillors was against it so there will be{no}merger.I think there should
